Message:
“Miss, can you deliver
this letter for me?”

A little girl ran up to me as
I trudged through my deliveries.

I quickly scanned over
those words on the envelope,
written in a clumsy,
childish scrawl.
Then, I took the letter
firmly in my hands.

“You know,
when I write my letters,
I feel like I’m talking to
my mommy in Heaven.”

After completing my
daily work report,
I laid a sheet of paper
on my desk.

“Talking to
my mommy in Heaven...”
Remembering those words,
I picked up my pen,
and my hand began
to move on its own.

“Dear Mom and Dad,
it’s been a while.
How are you two doing?

Today, I met
an interesting little girl...”
